casebody.data:
BERSHEBA BRILEY et al., plaintiffs in error, v. ABNER F. UNDERWOOD et al. June Term, 1870.) EQUITY FROM WHITE. When this cause was 'called in its order, A. S. Erwin and Hutchins and McMillan, who were represented by Hillyer & Brother, failed to furnish copies of the bill of exceptions, as required by the 12th Rule of Court, and the Court, ex stio mero motu, dismissed the cause. The same disposition was made of S. S. Barnard, plaintiff in error v. David McMurray, motion to set.aside a judgment from Baker. J. E. Bower for plaintiff in error.

(Atlanta,

In neither was there any appearance for the defendants.
